name: tree_divide_and_conquer
author: 张哲宇
complexity: O(n log n) for edge and point divide in typical cases; O(n log^2 n) for some applications with global balancing; space complexity is generally O(n).
summary: The paper discusses three tree-based divide-and-conquer techniques: edge centroid decomposition (edge divide), vertex centroid decomposition (point divide), and globally balanced binary trees. These methods are used to solve path or connectivity-related problems on trees by recursively decomposing the tree structure and solving subproblems efficiently.
